title: Creates the crime of aggravated harassment of a family member of a person in active military service
summary: Creates the crime of aggravated harassment of a family member of a person in active military service of the United States and makes such crime a class E felony.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1510

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 10, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced by M. of A. TEDISCO, McDONOUGH -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of
         A.  CONTE,  HAWLEY, KOLB -- read once and referred to the Committee on
         Codes

       AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation  to  creating  the  crime  of
         aggravated  harassment  of a family member of a person in active mili-
         tary service

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1. The penal law is amended by adding a new section 240.33 to
    2  read as follows:
    3  S 240.33 AGGRAVATED HARASSMENT OF A FAMILY MEMBER OF A PERSON IN  ACTIVE
    4             MILITARY SERVICE.
    5    1. A PERSON IS GUILTY OF AGGRAVATED HARASSMENT OF A FAMILY MEMBER OF A
    6  PERSON  IN  ACTIVE  MILITARY SERVICE WHEN, WITH INTENT TO HARASS, ANNOY,
    7  THREATEN OR ALARM ANOTHER PERSON, HE OR SHE EITHER:
    8    (A) COMMUNICATES WITH A PERSON, WHO AT THE TIME OF  THE  COMMUNICATION
    9  HAS  A FAMILY MEMBER IN ACTIVE MILITARY SERVICE OF THE UNITED STATES, AS
   10  SUCH TERM IS DEFINED IN  SECTION ONE OF THE MILITARY LAW, ANONYMOUSLY OR
   11  OTHERWISE, BY TELEPHONE, OR BY TELEGRAPH, MAIL  OR  ANY  OTHER  FORM  OF
   12  WRITTEN  COMMUNICATION,  IN  A MANNER LIKELY TO CAUSE ANNOYANCE OR ALARM
   13  AND SUCH COMMUNICATION RELATES TO THE MILITARY SERVICE OF SUCH  PERSON'S
   14  FAMILY MEMBER; OR
   15    (B) CAUSES A COMMUNICATION TO BE INITIATED BY MECHANICAL OR ELECTRONIC
   16  MEANS  OR  OTHERWISE WITH A PERSON, WHO AT THE TIME OF THE COMMUNICATION
   17  HAS A FAMILY MEMBER IN ACTIVE MILITARY SERVICE OF THE UNITED STATES,  AS
   18  SUCH  TERM IS DEFINED IN SECTION ONE OF THE MILITARY LAW, ANONYMOUSLY OR
   19  OTHERWISE, BY TELEPHONE, OR BY TELEGRAPH, MAIL  OR  ANY  OTHER  FORM  OF
   20  WRITTEN  COMMUNICATION,  IN  A MANNER LIKELY TO CAUSE ANNOYANCE OR ALARM
   21  AND SUCH COMMUNICATION RELATES TO THE MILITARY SERVICE OF SUCH  PERSON'S
   22  FAMILY MEMBER.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02034-01-1

       A. 1510                             2

    1    2.  FOR  THE  PURPOSES  OF  THIS  SECTION,  "FAMILY  MEMBER" MEANS THE
    2  HUSBAND, WIFE, SON, DAUGHTER, FATHER OR MOTHER OF A PERSON.
    3    AGGRAVATED  HARASSMENT  OF A FAMILY MEMBER OF A PERSON IN ACTIVE MILI-
    4  TARY SERVICE IS A CLASS E FELONY.
    5    S 2. This act shall take effect on the first of November next succeed-
    6  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the penal law, in relation to creating the crime of aggravated harassment of a family member of a person in active military service
